name: Fisheries management effectiveness and opportunity
description:
The opportunity for artisanal and recreational fishing based on the quality of management of the small- scale fishing sector (Mora et al 2009).

Data sources:

- Mora, C., Myers, R.A., Coll, M., Libralato, S., Pitcher, T.J., Sumaila, R.U., Worm, B. (2009). **Management Effectiveness of the Worldï¿s Marine Fisheries**. _PLoS Biol_, 7(6), e1000131. [doi:10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131](http://dx.doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131)

name: Purchasing power parity as a proxy for subsistence fishing need, by region
description:
The per capita purchasing power parity (PPP) adjusted gross domestic product (GDP): GDPpcPPP.

- The World Bank [GDP per capita, PPP (current international $)](http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD)

name: Coastal human population as a proxy for trend in trash
description:
Coastal population, defined as the total population inland of 25 miles, extracted from Gridded Population of the World (GPW) Population Density Grid Future Estimates.

name: Trends in fertilizer pollution as a proxy for nutrient pollution

name: Ocean acidification

name: Sea level rise

description:

- Mora et al. 2009. Management effectiveness of the world's marine fisheries. [PLoS Biol 7, e1000131](http://journals.plos.org/plosbiology/article?id=10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131).  

- [Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) Third National Report (habitat related questions) 2005](http://www.cbd.int/reports/search/default.shtml)

-  Marine Protected Areas from: United Nations - World Conservation Monitoring Centre's World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) through [Protected Planet](http://www.protectedplanet.net)

name: GCI: competitiveness in achieving sustained economic prosperity
description:
Global Competitiveness Index (GCI) scores from the World Economic Forum.

Data sources:

- [World Economic Forum](http://www.weforum.org/issues/global-competitiveness)

name: Sector evenness as a measure of economic diversity
description: Shannon's Diversity Index calculated sector evenness based on the total number of sectors and the proportion of jobs belonging to any sector.

Data sources:

In: A comparative assessment of biodiversity, fisheries and aquaculture in 53 countriesâ Exclusive Economic Zones, Alder J, Pauly D, editors. _Fisheries Centre Research Report_, vol. 16(7) p. 28â56.
